title: I can't find my books on Amazon, only orders in the last 6 months are shown. Does this mean they get to take away my past purchases? - Quora

response.answer_text: I asked the same question but i chose the wrong words and turned out as if i’m victimising myself against the mighty amazon. One guy went off his rails and said its a true “injustice” not to find your books on amazon!!! As if i’m living in a cave for not knowing amazon website like the back of my hand… following some other degrading labels thrown at me, then others started to follow, Where did all that came from… at his profile it said he works in neuroscience! I’m kinda sad we have so many high regarded social profile people with such low moral value, many look at it as weakness and illusion. We all know Amazon creates all kinds of manipulative marketing tricks to make you buy again and again and they set the tone for other corporations that grill out our pockets! we all experience it but so many people keep on acting like they’ve been stockholm syndromed by amazon… I think it’s a shame to ridiculize your peers by protecting these corporations who gives us a finger and takes back a hand! To avoid this trap and find your books you have to hover your mouse to accounts and lists, then click your account, then find manage content and devices somewhere on the page and click on it.

If you are referring to physical books that you’ve bought…. Look at the top left of your ORDERs page. There should be a line that reads xxx orders in the ( pull down box) past 6 months. You can use the pull down menu to set the time frame. now if you are referring to E-books… at the top right of the Amazon header under your user name is Accounts and Lists. Pull down the menu. Under the Accounts listing is Your Contents and Devices. Click on this and a listing of all the e-books that you have bought is there. By exploring the page you will see an option Devices. If you want to send a book to a device, again, click on Device and send it to your device, This is what I do for the Kindle App. if you have a physical a Kindle try this…. Your Kindle will redownload the book immediately. Press the "Home" button, if you are not already on your Kindle's Home screen.Press "Next Page" until you reach the last page of the Home screen.Click "Archived Items."Scroll through the history of deleted books and click the book you want to restore.I got this by googling How do I access and re-download kindle books.
